articles.description: Follow live text updates and BBC Radio 5 Live commentary as Burnley host Bournemouth and Man City face Man United in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Burnley host Bournemouth before Manchester derby

articles.description: Watch live coverage as Arsenal host Tottenham in the Women's Super League, plus text and radio commentary from four other games.
articles.title: WSL: Build-up as Arsenal host Tottenham at sold-out Emirates

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen move 10 points clear of Bayern Munich at the top of the Bundesliga following victory at 10-man Cologne.
articles.title: Alonso's Leverkusen win to go 10 points clear

articles.description: The controversy surrounding Red Bull boss Christian Horner is "driving people apart", says the father of the team's F1 champion Max Verstappen.
articles.title: Christian Horner: Jos Verstappen says controversy 'driving team apart'

articles.description: Alessia Russo scores the only goal of the game as Arsenal overcome local rivals Tottenham in front of a sellout crowd at Emirates Stadium.
articles.title: Russo gives Arsenal win over Spurs in front of 60,000

articles.description: Los Angeles Lakers star LeBron James becomes the first NBA player to reach 40,000 career regular-season points.
articles.title: NBA: LeBron James passes 40,000-point mark but LA Lakers lose to Denver Nuggets

articles.description: Jude Bellingham is sent off for complaining after the final whistle denies him a winning goal for Real Madrid in a dramatic game at Valencia.
articles.title: Bellingham sent off after full-time in Real draw

articles.description: Hearts beat 10-man Celtic to prevent the defending champions returning to the top of the Scottish Premiership.
articles.title: Hearts win to prevent 10-man Celtic going top

articles.description: Burnley's slim hopes of staying up suffer another setback as Bournemouth win in the Premier League for the first time in 2024 thanks to goals from Justin Kluivert and Antoine Semenyo.
articles.title: Burnley's survival hopes hit as Bournemouth win

articles.description: Chile's Joaquin Niemann claims his second victory of the season on the LIV Golf Tour, winning the Jeddah Invitational by four shots.
articles.title: LIV Golf: Chile's Joaquin Niemann wins Jeddah Invitational
